security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing pattern references and decision trees. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system access beyond reading its own markdown files. Allowed tools are Read and Grep only.

content.value_statement: Developers need consistent patterns when building applications. This skill provides decision trees and pattern references for Next.js, TypeScript, databases, APIs, and React 19. Choose the right pattern for each situation.
actual_capabilities: Guide pattern selection with decision trees
Reference Next.js Server and Client Components
Define database patterns with Drizzle ORM
Outline API design and validation patterns
limitations: Contains pattern references, not full implementations
Links to comprehensive skills for details
Examples are templates, not production code
No code execution or file modifications

prompt_templates.prompt: Should I use React Query, useState, or Context for storing user authentication state?

output_examples.input: Should I use Server Component or Client Component for a profile page that displays user data?
output: ‚Üí Use Server Component for data fetching and display
‚Üí Use Client Component only for interactivity (buttons, forms)
‚Üí Pattern: Fetch data in Server Component, pass to Client Component for interactivity

best_practices: Prefer Server Components for data fetching to reduce client bundle size
Use Zod schemas for input validation at API boundaries
Apply type guards and explicit types for TypeScript strict mode
Choose state solution based on data source: server, local UI, or shared UI
anti_patterns: Using useState for server data instead of React Query or Server Components
Using string concatenation for SQL queries instead of parameterized queries
Using @ts-ignore instead of fixing underlying type errors
Fetching data in useEffect when Server Component data fetching would work
